name: NPR
text: Fireworks display companies are struggling to make ends meet during what's usually their peak season. One company says business is down 90% this year — estimating a $3 million loss so far. https://t.co/h7IH2ZxrCY

name: NPR
text: Three Aurora, Colo. police officers -- including Jason Rosenblatt, who used a chokehold on Elijah McClain last summer before he had a fatal heart attack -- were fired today following an investigation into photos taken near McClain's memorial. https://t.co/q94WL3IqVX

name: NPR
text:
Silvia Moreno-Garcia's latest is true Gothic horror — set in 1950s Mexico in an isolated house where a young bride believes her new husband is poisoning her and "fleshless things" are troubling her.

A warning from our critic: Don't read it before bed. https://t.co/4SX8LaOuQW

name: NPR
text: Chicago has issued a quarantine order for travelers from states with surging coronavirus cases. As of Monday, people coming to the city from 15 states in the South and West will be asked to quarantine for two weeks or face up to $7,000 in fines. @WBEZ https://t.co/UhIMZvm8zp

name: NPR
text:
Major League Baseball has canceled this year's All-Star game.The only other time the 87-year-old game has been called off was in 1945, when wartime travel restrictions interfered. 

Los Angeles, which was set to host the game, will get it in 2022. 

https://t.co/qdNhNI4xYe

name: NPR
text: Francesca Montanaro is at her dad’s New York pizza shop a few days a week, constructing pizza boxes, learning the register and scooping Italian ice. "Sometimes I feel bored, mostly because there's nothing really to do there for an 11-year-old like me." https://t.co/TqRyhqhB4U

name: NPR
text: Across the U.S., rural "critical access" hospitals were already closing at an alarming rate before the pandemic. Twelve have shuttered since the start of this year alone. https://t.co/2ZtzuAPneG

name: NPR
text: So how likely is it that the person in line ahead of you at the coffee shop could be infected with COVID-19? Local data offer clues to hot spots. https://t.co/f9YqarpZFK

name: NPR
text: On the eve of Independence Day, President Trump delivered a speech at Mount Rushmore National Memorial condemning protesters who want Confederate statues and monuments removed, as well as what he called a "new far-left fascism." https://t.co/QdrCdshfg9

name: NPR
text: On July 4, America will celebrate 244 years since the continental congress adopted the Declaration of Independence. NPR marks the celebration with what has become a Morning Edition tradition: the annual reading of that document. https://t.co/KR0cy8phgE

name: NPR
text: Five different national polls released this week found on average that 70% of Americans thought the country was on the wrong track. Can we call it the Fourth and hear the heartbeat of summer when celebration seems so out of sync with the rest of our lives? https://t.co/doEKMQegAW

name: NPR
text:
The nation's largest movie theater chain AMC is delaying its U.S. reopening until the end of July to coincide with the updated release dates of Warner Brothers' "Tenet" and Disney's "Mulan."
https://t.co/UrgEXWBiWt

name: NPR
text:
“We have a lot of work to do, but there’s still hope...”

Young descendants of Frederick Douglass read and respond to his famous “Fourth of July” speech. https://t.co/qbRSNAXywk

name: NPR
text:
The State Dept. ended the sale of military equipment to Hong Kong and the U.K. said it would offer a pathway to British citizenship for Hong Kongers — the latest flares of retaliation against China over its new national security law.
https://t.co/GUlWegOTAv

name: NPR
text: Starting July 10, England will no longer require travelers from more than 50 nations to quarantine for 14 days. But the change does not apply to travelers from the U.S. https://t.co/dVoyPEY83V

name: NPR
text:
How do Black people in America reconcile experiences of racism and systemic discrimination with pride in their country? 

We broached this topic in a series of conversations with more than a dozen Black people across the country from various backgrounds. https://t.co/ah5kKq54nD https://t.co/GiECScpcDy

name: NPR
text: Two women have been hospitalized — one with life-threatening injuries — after a vehicle barreled past a police barrier and into protesters on a freeway overnight in Seattle. https://t.co/vukDopYmFJ
